tuv.seg: An affidavit is a written sworn statement from a witness in a case
Ráiteas faoi mhionn ó fhinné is ea mionnscríbhinn
It is a document that sets out in paragraph form the evidence that the witness wishes to give
Doiciméad is ea í a leagann amach i bparagraif an fhianaise ar mhian leis an bhfinné a thabhairt
Affidavits are usually written and prepared by a solicitor or a barrister after having obtained all the necessary information from the witness
Go hiondúil déanann aturnae nó abhcóide na mionnscríbhinní a scríobh agus a ullmhú tar éis an t-eolas riachtanach a bhailiú ón bhfinné
When the affidavit is ready, the witness must go before a Commissioner for Oaths
Nuair atá an mionnscríbhinn réidh, ní mór don fhinné dul os comhair Coimisnéara Mionnaí
The Commissioner for Oaths will check that the person swearing the oath has read the affidavit and fully understands the contents
Cinnteoidh Coimisinéir na Mionnaí go bhfuil an mionnscríbhinn léite agus tuigthe go hiomlán ag an té atá ag tabhairt an míonna
The witness will be asked to raise the Bible and to repeat the words of the oath
Iarrfar ar an bhfinné an Bíobla a ardú agus focail an mhíonna a athrá
If the witness does not wish to swear an oath on the Bible, he or she may make an affirmation
Murar mhian leis an bhfinné mionn a thabhairt ar an mBíobla, is féidir leis nó léi dearbhascadh a dhéanamh
He or she will then sign the affidavit
Is féidir leis nó léi an mionnscríbhinn a shíniú ansin
The Commissioner for Oaths will verify that the affidavit was properly sworn by completing a jurat on the affidavit
Déanfaidh Coimisinéir na Mionnaí a dhearbhú gur tugadh an mionnscríbhinn go ceart trí jurat a chur ar an mionnscríbhinn
It may then be submitted as evidence to the court by lodging it in the appropriate court office and sending a duplicate to the other party in the case
Is féidir í a chur os comhair na cúirte ansin mar fhianaise ach í a fhágáil san oifig chúirte chuí agus cóip a chur chuig an páirtí eile sa chás
Some cases do not involve an oral hearing with witnesses giving evidence in court
I roinnt cásanna ní bhactar le h-éisteacht bhéil le fianaise á tabhairt ag finnéithe sa chúirt
Those cases may be dealt with by affidavit only
Ní féidir plé leis na cásanna sin ach trí mhionnscríbhinn amháin
For example, if the Plaintiff issues a summary summons, it will be accompanied by an affidavit setting out the facts of the case
Mar shampla, má eisíonn an Comhghearánaí toghairm achomair, beidh mionnscríbhinn leis a leagfaidh amach fíricí an cháis
The Defendant may then respond by affidavit
Is féidir leis an gCosantóir freagairt trí mhionnscríbhinn ansin
The judge may be able to decide the case by simply reading the affidavits
Is féidir leis an mbreitheamh an cás a shocrú trí na mionnscríbhinní a léamh
This is a swifter and less expensive procedure
Nós imeacht níos tapúla agus níos saoire é seo
An affidavit must include the following information:
Ní mór go n-áirítear le mionnscríbhinn an fhaisnéis a leanas:
• The identity of the person making the affidavit and their occupation and address
• Aitheantas an duine a bhfuil an mhionnscríbhinn á déanamh acu agus a ngairm agus a seoladh
• It must state that the witness is over 18 years of age or, if not over 18, the age of the witness
• Ní mór go luafar inti go bhfuil an finné os cionn 18 mbliana d’aois nó, mura bhfuil siad os cionn 18 mbliana d’aois, ní mór aois an fhinné a lua
• In general, the evidence must be confined to such facts as the witness is able to prove of their own knowledge and must state the means of such knowledge
• Go ginearálta, ní mór nach bhfuil san fhianaise ach na fíricí sin ar féidir leis an bhfinné a chruthú lena n-eolas féin agus ní mór go luafar meáin an eolais sin
• The affidavit must be dated and signed by the witness
• Ní mór don fhinné an mhionnscríbhinn a dhátú agus a shíniú
• The affidavit must contain a jurat which is a section where the Commissioner for Oaths verifies that the affidavit was properly sworn
• Ní mór go bhfuil giúrád sa mhionnscríbhinn, ar mír í ina bhfíoraíonn an Coimisinéir gur mionnaíodh an mhionnscríbhinn i gceart
The evidence that the witness gives must be set out clearly in numbered paragraph format
Ní mór an fhianaise a thugann an finné bheith leagtha amach go soiléir i bhformáid alt uimhrithe
The language is less formal that the language of formal pleadings
Níl an friotal chomh foirmiúil céanna a bhíonn friotal pléadálacha foirmiúla
The rules for affidavits are set out in the court rules for the Superior, Circuit and District courts which are available on the Courts Service website
Leagtar amach na rialacha maidir le mionnscríbhinní i rialacha na cúirte do na hUaschúirteanna, na Cúirteanna Cuarda agus Dúiche atá ar fáil ar láithreán gréasáin na Seirbhíse Cúirteanna
The stamp duty that must be paid when an affidavit is lodged in the Circuit Court office is €15
Is é €15 an stampdhleacht a chaithfear a íoc nuair a chuirtear mionnscríbhinn isteach in oifig na Cúirte Cuarda
In the High Court Central office, the duty is €20
I lároifig na hArdchúirte is é €20 an stampdhleacht
Your solicitor and barrister will also charge fees for their services
Iarrfaidh do aturnae agus d'abhcóide táillí ar a gcuid seirbhísí chomh maith
For more detailed information you should seek legal advice
Ba chóir duit comhairle dlí a lorg chun faisnéis mionsonraithe a fháil
